(l.c. p.148) that the <s>[text?]<\s>
venous sinuses “enter the two 
hearts or dilated sinuses which are 
situated exterior to the liver and in T.
chilensis & T. sowerbii just within the 
origins of the internal calcareous loop.”
<s>[text?]<\s> 
The fact is, that while the ilio parietal 
bands support the two ‘hearts’ as usual 
the gastro-parietal bands likewise possess two 
The base of the ‘auricle’ of the latter <s>[text?]<\s>
opens into the re-entering angle 
formed by gastroparietal band with 
the parietes, while its apex is directed 
backwards to join the ventricle - which 
passes <s>directly <\s> downwards & backwards along the 
posterior edge of the posterior division 
of the adductor muscle 
The auricles in <u>Rhynchonella <\u> are far 
smaller than in both actually & proportionally
